title: Changing cross entropy loss to hinge loss
body:
I have applied the model to my own dataset, and trying to explore using hinge loss instead of cross entropy loss for doing binary classification (to determine is the answer is a suitable answer for my question).

However, am not too sure i am doing this correctly.


I have changed this line in model.py:
loss = F.cross_entropy(logits, y)

to:
loss = my_hinge_loss(logits, y.reshape(y.shape[0],1), self.config['margin'])
loss = torch.mean(loss)

########## 
This is my own hinge loss function ( i wrote my own as pytorch embedding hinge loss will result in negative loss):

def my_hinge_loss(logits, labels, margin):
    
    # converts label into -1 and 1
    labels[labels==0] = -1 
    labels = labels.float()

    # while i use relu here, is effective the same as max(0, margin-labels*logits)
    return F.relu(margin-labels*logits, inplace=False)



Question 
Am i correct in passing in logits to compute hinge loss directly?


Referring to 2 results that i have attached (with different margin and learning rate as per indicated):
Any idea why does the ACC fluctuates so much ? Is it because my margin is too wide? is these level of fluctuation normal for hinge lost?
